result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anton D Bratton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Anton D Bratton.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective G. Fraley. Court took judicial notice of 16CF2947. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anton D Bratton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Anton D Bratton.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Attorney Wineke was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Discussion placed on the record. Court REINSTATED TIME LIMITS. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 is changed to 10:45am. 
Information provided to ADA Mathy, Public Defender's Office and HOC.

Defendant Anton D Bratton appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anton D Bratton not in court, in custody in HOC. Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brittnee J H or Aiyden S W.

Defendant Anton D Bratton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Anton D Bratton.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
